short_summary: Provides bio-technical support services for Fisheries and Oceans Canada.
description: This contract will provide bio-technical support services to Fisheries and Oceans Canada. Responsibilities included providing technical support to CIP projects, conducting fish production, restorative and enhanced habitat, salmon stock assessment, education and awareness, and administration.
duration_in_months: If awarded this contract, it is intended to begin on or after the date the contract is signed and continue for the duration of the term as outlined in the tender documents. In general, CIP projects are multi-year projects, and the length of the contract will be determined when the implementation plan is completed.
full_summary:
===============

### Tender Name / Title
Biological and Technical Support Services: South Coast – Comox Valley

### Reference Number
PW-22-01016539

### Publication Date
2022-12-08

### Tender Closing Date
2022-12-19T13:00:00

### Type of Procurement
Competitive - Open Bidding

### Region of Opportunity
Canada

### Region of Delivery
British Columbia

### Contractor Requirements
Fisheries and Oceans Canada is seeking a contractor to provide biological and technical support services for various projects in the South Coast – Comox Valley region. Key activities include:

*   Fish production: collecting broodstock, spawning and incubation, hatchery rearing of juvenile salmon, operating sea pens, and providing fish culture support to CIP hatcheries.
*   Restored/ Enhanced Habitat: conducting fry salvage programs, riparian planting and management, water quality and temperature monitoring, habitat surveys and mapping, and habitat restoration.
*   Salmon Stock Assessment: including juvenile salmon counting programs, juvenile salmon density inventories, hydraulic sampling programs, sampling for biological traits, and adult escapement assessment.
*   Education and Awareness: providing classroom sessions, hosting educational field trips, developing and delivering educational programs, participating in trade shows/education fairs/community events.
*   Administration: providing support to CIP participants on project development and implementation, project funding applications, and report writing.

### Contract Details
*   Expected contract start date: Not specified
*   Expected contract end date: Not specified
*   Number of amendments: 0
*   Trade agreements applicable: Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)

### Contact Information
For more information, please contact:

Martin, Kimberly
DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca
506-429-2397
http://www.esrdc.com

Please note, work priorities can change quickly and often on short notice, and the contractor should be able to adapt to various situations.
